dt: {bc}a green or greenish-blue poisonous pigment resulting from the action of acetic acid on copper and consisting of one or more basic copper acetates
{bc}a green or bluish deposit especially of copper carbonates formed on copper, brass, or bronze surfaces

et: Middle English {it}vertegrese{/it}, borrowed from Anglo-French {it}verdegrece, vert de Grece{/it}, literally, "green of Greece"
The current form reflects French {it}vert-de-gris{/it}, with the final syllable assimilated to {it}gris{/it} "gray."
shortdef: a green or greenish-blue poisonous pigment resulting from the action of acetic acid on copper and consisting of one or more basic copper acetates
a green or bluish deposit especially of copper carbonates formed on copper, brass, or bronze surfaces

dt: river 351 miles (565 kilometers) long in southeastern Kansas and northeastern Oklahoma flowing into the Arkansas River

shortdef: river 351 miles (565 kilometers) long in southeastern Kansas and northeastern Oklahoma flowing into the Arkansas River
